string-array.name: data_fragments
string-array.item: { _id : \"3\", position : \"3\", name : \"To Be or Not To Be\" }
{ _id : \"6\", position : \"6\", name : \"And Let\'s Group Them Verbs\" }
{ _id : \"12\", position : \"12\", name : \"Do This, That and That\" }

string-array.name: table_contents
string-array.item: { column : \"_id\", type : \"INTEGER\", extra : \"PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT NOT NULL\" }

string-array.name: data_contents
string-array.item: { fragment_id : \"1\", style : \"FragmentLeftTextView\", content : \"Hello World! こんにちわ！ Welcome to Benkyou no Nikki. This app is written to help me review my notes from when I was studying Japanese.\" }

{ fragment_id : "1", style : "FragmentLeftTextView", content : "Sources: 
 1) Human Japanese 2.0 by Brak Software, Inc 
 2) Minna No Nihongo: Beginner 1, 2nd Edition 
 3) Various websites on the internet" }

{ fragment_id : \"3\", style : \"FragmentLeftTextView\", content : \"In the example above, the verb たべます, which means eats, is put at the end of the sentence. This rule holds true for every Japanese sentence.\n\nMore examples below:\" }
{ fragment_id : \"6\", style : \"FragmentLeftTextView\", content : \"We\'ll start with the third group because this group contains only 2 verbs. These verbs are called irregular verbs.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"6\", style : \"FragmentLeftTextView\", content : \"The verbs in this group are called Ru-verbs or Vowel-stem-verbs or いちだんどうし(ichidan-doushi). Notice the \'e\' vowel right before ます(masu).\" }
{ fragment_id : \"6\", style : \"FragmentLeftTextView\", content : \"However, there are some exceptions. Some of the verbs have the \'i\' vowel right before ます(masu).\" }

{ fragment_id : \"6\", style : \"FragmentLeftTextView\", content : \"The verbs in this group are called U-verbs or Consonant-stem-verbs or ごだんどうし(godan-doushi). All the verbs have the \'i\' vowel right before ます(masu).\" }

{ fragment_id : \"8\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"すみませんが、でんわばんごうをおしえてください。 \nSumimasen ga, denwabangou (w)o oshiete kudasai. \nI\'m sorry but can you please tell me your phone number?\" }
{ fragment_id : \"8\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"どうぞたくさんたべてください。 \nDouzo takusan tabete kudasai. \nKindly, please eat a lot.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"10\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"このホッチキスをつかってもいいです。 \nKono Hocchikisu (w)o tsukatte mo ii desu. \nIt\'s OK to use this Hotchkiss(stapler).\" }
{ fragment_id : \"10\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"ここにすわってもいいです。 \nKoko ni suwatte mo ii desu. \nIt\'s OK to sit here.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"12\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"パンをたべて、コヒーをのんで、しんぶんをよみます。 \nPan (w)o tabete, kohii (w)o nonde, shinbun (w)o yomimasu. \nI eat bread, drink coffee and read newspapers.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"12\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"あしたこうべへいって、えいがをみて、かいものします。 \nAshita Koube (h)e itte, eiga (w)o mite, kaimono shimasu. \nTomorrow she will go to Kobe, watch a movie and shop.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"12\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"きのうのばんほんをよんで、CDをきいて、ねました。 \nKinou no ban hon (w)o yonde, CD (w)o kiite, nemashita. \nYesterday evening he read a book, listened to a CD and slept.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"12\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"にちようび十じごろおきて、さんぽして、ひるごはんをたべました。 \nNichiyoubi juuji goro okite, sanpo shite, hirugohan (w)o tabemashita. \nLast Sunday we woke up around 10 o\'clock, took a walk and ate lunch.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"13\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"うちへかえってから、ばんごはんをたべます。 \nUchi (h)e kaette kara, bangohan (w)o tabemasu. \nAfter I return home, I will eat dinner.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"13\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"でんわをかけてから、ともだちのうちへいきます。 \nDenwa (w)o kakete kara, tomodachi no uchi (h)e ikimasu. \nAfter he hangs up the phone, he will go to his friend\'s house.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"13\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"しごとがおわってから、およぎました。 \nShigoto ga owatte kara, oyogimashita. \nAfter work, she swam.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"14\", style : \"FragmentCenterTextView\", content : \"We use te form to combine multiple adjectives in one sentence. Remember, we can only combine positive adjectives together, or negative adjectives together in that one sentence.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"14\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"わかくて、げんきです。 \nWakakute, genki desu. \nHe is young and healthy.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"14\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"あたまがよくて、おもしろいです。 \nAtama ga yokute, omoshiroi desu. \nShe is smart and funny.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"14\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"ハンサムで、 しんせつです。 \nHansamude, shinsetsu desu. \nHe is handsome and kind.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"14\", style : \"FragmentBorderedTextView\", content : \"二十八さいで、 どくしんです。 \nNijuuhassaide, dokushin desu. \nShe is 28 years old and single.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"22\", style : \"FragmentCenterTextView\", content : \"\'\'なくても いいです\'\' is very similar to \'\'ても いいです\'\'. The latter means \'\'It is OK to do ...\'\', while the earlier means \'\'It doesn\'t matter if you do ..., and it doesn\'t matter if you don\'t\'\'.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"16\", style : \"FragmentCenterTextView\", content : \"じしょ (jisho) means dictionary in Japanese. If you search in the dictionary, you will not find the ます ending verbs - you will have to use the dictionary form. Why are we only learning this form now? Well, I actually learnt the dictionary form first before the other forms, but I think learning the ます form first makes it much easier to recognize and memorize groups I, II and III.\" }
{ fragment_id : \"17\", style : \"FragmentCenterTextView\", content : \"This is the plain past form. To conjugate a verb to ta form, just change て to た and で to だ from its te form.\" }

{ fragment_id : \"18\", style : \"FragmentCenterTextView\", content : \"The ふつう (general) form is nothing but the じしょ (dictionary) form, ない (nai) form, た form and the past form of ない (nai) form used on どうし (verbs), いけいようし (i-adjectives), なけいようし (na-adjectives) and めいし (nouns).\" }
